intro: Macrostigmatella longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled stigmate, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its most distinctive feature is the elongated style of its flowers, which is a notable botanical trait. It is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
